questions.question: Do you know ................................. Samuel lives?
questions.description: Where is a question word indicating place. Were is a primary auxiliary verb used to make the past continuous and simple past tense forms.

questions.question: How many people ............................ there at the party?
questions.description: Where is a question word indicating place. Were is a primary auxiliary verb used to make the past continuous and simple past tense forms.

questions.question: The dog has had ................................ breakfast.
questions.description: It's means it is or it has. Its is a possessive word like his or her.

questions.question: ............................... time you stopped reading my letters.
questions.description: It's means it is or it has. Its is a possessive word like his or her.

questions.question: There is a .................................. in my socks.
questions.description: Whole means complete. It is similar to all. A hole is an opening in something.

questions.question: I spent the .............................. week at home.
questions.description: Whole means complete. It is similar to all. A hole is an opening in something.

questions.question: It was a decision ............................... importance I didn't realize at that time.
questions.description: Whose is a possessive word meaning 'of which'. Who's is the contraction of who is or who has.

questions.question: Do you know anybody ............................ going to Japan next month?
questions.description: Who's means who is or who has. Whose is a possessive word meaning 'of which'.

questions.question: They have never invited us to ................................ parties.
questions.description: Their is a possessive word like his or here. There is the opposite of here. It indicates position.

questions.question: Take a ................................... of paper and jot down this number.
questions.description: A piece is a portion separated from the whole. Peace is freedom from fear, anxiety or war.

questions.question: The war ...................................... oil prices.
questions.description: Affect is a verb. It has a past simple form - affected. Effect is a noun. It has a plural form - effects

questions.question: The cold weather had an adverse ................................ on my health.
questions.description: Affect is a verb. Effect is a noun.
